description: Mushroom and plum aromas followed by coffee and black plum flavors. Hot, heavy and over the top.
title: Château Comte Saint Martin 2000  Bordeaux

description: This very ripe wine tastes of supermature grapes; it' s soft and formless.
title: Château Timberlay 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Lean and rather dry, this has old wood and lean fruit flavors.
title: Château Majoureau 2009 Hyppos  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The problem with this wine is the wood. There is too much of it, and the toasting is too high, giving a burnt character to the wine. For a 2005, this should be better integrated, and is likely to just dry out.
title: Château Tour de Calens 2005  Graves

description: Earthy, with little fruit. The flavors are thin and much like strawberry infused tea. Acidic and dry. Barely acceptable.
title: Mouton-Cadet 1999 Réserve  (Médoc)

description: Remember that old TV commercial asking, "Where's the beef?" You can apply that here. It smells fresh enough, and there's cranberry-styled tart fruit backed up by oak. But it's way short on soul and stuffing. No need to hold this; drink it now for what fruit there is. Made from 75% Merlot.
title: Château des Mille Anges 1996  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Husky and muddled, with less than precise plum and berry flavors. The flavor profile doesn't sing and the finish is lean, drying and even a touch bitter at its culmination.
title: La Croix Bonis 1998 Grand Vin de Bordeaux  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: Green and underripe, with tobacco and rhubarb aromas. The flavors are too weedy and burnt for the wine to merit higher, and that's despite a perfectly good mouthfeel. Kosher.
title: Château du Quint 1999  Pomerol

description: Horsey and heavy in the nose, with some cinnamon sweetness. The fruit is big and overstuffed, like plum pie. There's also a burnt flavor and potent acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2000 Roi Chevalier  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Aromas and flavors of rhubarb and red pepper dominate, resulting in a wine that is sharp and unbalanced.
title: Château Dubraud 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is very light, in both flavor and body. The aromas are earthy, with a faint suggestion of blackberries, and the mouthfeel is thin. These aren't terrible flaws, but the wine just lacks substance.
title: Château Maine-Gazin 1997  Bordeaux

description: This is very light, in both flavor and body. The aromas are earthy, with a faint suggestion of blackberries, and the mouthfeel is thin. These aren't terrible flaws, but the wine just lacks substance.
title: Château Maine-Gazin 1997  Bordeaux

description: This wine has been too heavily extracted, giving a series of tough tannins and a hard edge without the fruit to balance things out. It is a blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25/25 Merlot and Cabernet Franc.
title: Château de Seguin 2013 La Vieille Cour de Seguin  (Bordeaux)

description: Meat and bacon aromas lead to a dry, tannic wine. It only hints at a fruity future.
title: Château Moulin de Mallet 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is an unfocused wine that has jammy fruit and soft tannins. It tastes overripe. Not for aging.
title: Château de Lavagnac 2011  Bordeaux

description: Meat and bacon aromas introduce a wine that is taut, structured and high on the acidity. It has a lean, slightly dirty taste, which is not attractive.
title: Château Tire Pé 2009  Bordeaux

description: A lean, rather attenuated wine. It has some pleasant red fruits, but is too dilute. Drink now, while the fruit is still fresh.
title: Caves Fleury 2005  Bordeaux

description: This wine has too much extraction to allow the fruit to develop. It will soften out, although not enough. It is an 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon blend.
title: Château de Marsan 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A southern yet herbal-feeling wine, this is ripe-maybe overripe-and missing real structure or fruitiness.
title: Château Bellevue Favereau 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine's fruit is overripe, which spoils the structure that has been built around it.
title: Château Bellevue 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is all wood, with no promise of fruit.
title: Château la Verriére 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While there is plenty of wood here (12 months in new barrels), the raisin character of the 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon gives it a curious, dried-fruit flavor.
title: Château de Lestiac 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: All dry tannin and bramble aromas, this wine is a tough proposition. François Maurin and son Raphael handle the organic vineyards and wine fermented in stainless steel.
title: Château la Croix Blanche 2013  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A hard, very firm, lean wine, showing structure and tannins but little in the way of substance. Old-style winemaking produces an old style wine.
title: Château d'Arcins 2004  Haut-Médoc

description: Already showing signs of aging, this is hard, dry and tough. Not much pleasure there.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2006  Médoc

description: The nose features some plum and faint cedar aromas, but not a lot of intensity; the light black-cherry and cedar flavors incorporate some earthy nuances on the finish. Light and correct, but where's the beef?
title: Michel Lynch 1998  Bordeaux

description: Weak cherry and cassis aromas are followed by dilute raspberry flavors. The finish is tangy and borderline thin, while the overall impression is sharp and tart. Despite all that it tastes fresh, not tired. Kosher.
title: Tour Saint-Laurent 1999  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine has too much tannin for its own good. It's tough and bitter, showing wood and extraction. In this difficult Bordeaux vintage, the vineyard produced less than half what is normal.
title: Château Frédignac 2013 La Favorite  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is all toast and smoky wood flavors though it spent only six to eight months in oak. It is extracted and hard, with little fruit.
title: Château Les Gatines 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Overripe, jammy fruits and dry tannins are an odd combination. They don't work in this wine that has a hot character. This is the first vineyard in Blaye certified by Terra Vitis for sustainable viticulture.
title: Château Ricaud 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A diffuse wine without focus. The tannins and the fruit are some way apart, while the final flavor is dry and tough.
title: Château la Petite Roque 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bell peppers and green herbs as well as dark tannins are the main characters of this very dry, bitter wine.
title: Château des Tourtes 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This unfocused wine has hard tannins and a firm structure. What's missing is the fruit, which may not come through.
title: Maison Hebrard 2016 Bel Air  (Bordeaux)

description: I know Bordeaux isn't known for being fruit-driven, but this paucity of fruit in a wine that's 50% Merlot (from a vintage that favored this variety's development) is hard to fathom. Leather and old wood combine with earth and mushrooms. There's decent weight and intensity here, so if these are flavors you look for this is an example to seek out.
title: Château Ducla 1998  Bordeaux

description: The wine is dry, laden with wood flavors rather than fruit. It has a hard over-extracted edge that will stay with the wine as it ages.
title: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is an unfocused wine with fruit flavors that miss the mark. Only the juicy aftertaste is attractive.
title: Château Chavrignac 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a tight woody wine that is hard and over-extracted. Some fruit may come through but it is hard to imagine.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2014  Bordeaux

description: You need to work hard to find the fruit in this 100% Merlot. It is tough, only hinting at acidity and black currant flavors.
title: Château Queyssard 2013  Bordeaux

description: Dry tannins and wood flavors give a hard character. It's tough to see beyond the wine's dryness and find the fruit.
title: Château Mezain 2012  Bordeaux

description: Crisp fruitiness and acidity show the fruit is not ripe. It's a herbal and stalky.
title: Château Haut Roudier 2012  Bordeaux

description: While this wine is still young, the level of smoky wood aging flavors is enormous. It's all about planks and not about fruit, not taking into account the light vintage. Could the black fruits develop? Certainly, but maybe not enough.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a wine that is totally dominated by wood. So much so that there is little sign of fruit. Maybe it will integrate, but there is a question mark.
title: Maison Bouey 2011 Cuvée  (Bordeaux)

description: Overripe fruit makes this wine, which is light and fruity, with little structure.
title: Château Haut Maginet 2011  Bordeaux

description: This firm, dry wine is all tannins and bitter extraction. It has a hard side to it that the juicy fruit cannot balance.
title: Château Lafont Fourcat 2010  Bordeaux

description: Fruity and without structure, this wine is soft and feels rather dilute. The red fruits dominate and will age quickly. Screwcap.
title: Château la Freynelle 2009  Bordeaux

description: Dry, dark-hued tannins cut through the wine, giving it a bitter feel. It is tough, firm, missing the balancing fruit.
title: Château de Virecourt 2009  Bordeaux

description: Indulgent wood and high toast flavors swamp the fruit here. The result is a wine that is lean, hard-edged and without the weight to develop.
title: Château Larroque 2006  Bordeaux

description: A simple, fruity wine, the fruit on the lean side, with black currant flavors and fresh berry acidity. There is an unfortunate rustic edge to the tannins.
title: Château Grand Jean 2009  Bordeaux

description: A tight, firmly tannic wine. It does show pleasing berry fruits, and it has freshness, but the acidity is very apparent, and courses through the fruit and tannins. The finish is tart black currant. Screwcap.
title: Château de Virecourt 2005  Bordeaux

description: A raw-edged wine, with dusty tannins and blackberry fruits and sawdust wood flavors that don't quite gel, and some green asparagus flavors to finish.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2005 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: The toffee aromas of this wine are followed by an unbalanced character of Clairet on the palate. Dry and not very fruity now, it will probably remain like this.
title: Château de Marsan 2017  Bordeaux Clairet

description: The acidity that is a characteristic of the vintage shows through in this wine. It clashes with the tannins to give a strangely unbalanced wine.
title: Château de Parenchére 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: High levels of acidity give this wine a tight, eye-watering character. The fruit was probably not ripe.
title: Château Bellevue Peycharneau 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is dry, firm with chocolate and bitter extraction flavors. It's likely to remain dry.
title: Château Lacombe Cadiot 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Hard and extracted, this is a tough number. The fruit seems lean and the bitter chocolate flavor is not promising much. It may work with food.
title: Château de Ricaud 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The unfocused wine tastes soapy, with bitterness and little fruit. Not a wine to enjoy now or in the future.
title: Château Les Graviéres de la Brandille 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur
winery: Château Les Graviéres de la Brandille

description: There is an awkwardness to this wine, coming from the overripe fruit and juicy character. It lacks structure and will likely age quickly.
title: Trocard 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A meat-flavored wine without much charm, this has tannins and red berry notes, along with a strong whiff of sulfur.
title: Château de Monrecueil 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is bizarrely perfumed: It tastes like a candy shop smells, with a note of fruit jelly. The tannins are taut, but the wine doesn't hang together.
title: Château Recougne 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: On the lean side, this wine has an intense black-currant flavor and acidity, producing a wine that tastes mean and is not likely to age.
title: Château de Lisennes 2009 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The fruit seems overripe, with a juicy character. A core of tannins balances the palate, and a meaty flavor creeps in on the finish.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Heavily wooded wine, so dry, with the fruit lost in all the burnt toast character. It's all too much for the fresh style of 2008.
title: Château de Parenchére 2008 Esprit de Parenchére  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A Merlot-dominated wine, soft, fresh, the tannins a whisper under red berry fruits. This simple freshness is spoilt by a dirty edge to the acidity, giving a final bitterness.
title: Château Saint-Léon 2006  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A lean wine with some austerity. It has a firmly tannic character while missing the fruit for the future.
title: Château Brethous 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This old-vine wine shows signs of rotten fruit, certainly aromatically. On the palate, it is tight with dark tannins and a hard, extracted edge. It is hard to tell if it could soften. This property liess in both the Castillon and Franc appellations. Wine is vinified plot by plot.
title: Château Terrasson 2013 Cuvée Prevenche  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine has a jammy character with acidity that is unbalanced. Wine is made in cement tanks and aged in cement tanks and new and up to three-year-old French oak barrels.
title: Château Dina 2013  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The new wood and spice flavors still show in this wine. A dry, woody character is still keeping the fruit back. Black coffee flavors show that there was heavy extraction. This 20-acre property is one of four in the greater Saint-Émilion area owned by the Lannoye family.
title: Château Moulin de  Clotte 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A lean and underweight wine. It has some juicy fruit but it misses depth of flavor.
title: Château la Rode 2009  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rustic, barnyard aromas with flavors of hedgerow red berries and light acidity. The style is fruity; the sweet fruits are shot through with some licorice and beetroot flavors.
title: Château du Bousquet 2005  Cotes de Bourg

description: An over-oaked wine. The lean 2007 fruit cannot cope with the wood, resulting in a wine that is one-dimensional.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2007  Cotes de Castillon

description: All tannin, this wine is missing fruit, although the acidity hints at some fading freshness. It is tough and dry, not offering much real pleasure.
title: Château d'Esteau 2004  Haut-Médoc

description: Mature Bordeaux from a not very good vintage. It is drying up, the flesh gone, just the bare bones of tannin remaining.
title: Château Tour Grand Colombier 2007  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Olive and pickle notes run on top of the fruit on the nose, while more olive character along with coffee and black fruit carry the palate. Vibrancy is not this wine's calling card; it's more dark, earthy and ultimately kind of flat.
title: Château Tour Pibran 1998 Cru Bourgeois  (Pauillac)

description: Red cherry aromas lead to a wine that is curiously structured with firm tannins and jammy fruit that is not in balance. "Natur" means the winemaker did not add sulfites during wine production.
title: Château Penin 2013 Natur  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is all about dryness, with hard-edged fruit and firm tannins.
title: Château la Gamaye 2016 Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine, with its dry tannins, is dense while unfocussed. It will remain tannin dominated.
title: Château Les Petits 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine smells of over-ripe fruit and this sensation continues through the palate. The fruit and the tannins don't coincide.
title: Château Metairie Neuve 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine has fresh acidity and attractive black currant fruit flavors. They are given a hard ride by the dark and bitter tannins and dry texture. This is a Carreau family wine.
title: Château Les Petits Arnaud 2013  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Vanilla and caramel flavors dominate this wine after 12 months in French oak. That means that the fruit is really not allowed to shine. It is firm, very dry and all about spice. A pepper flavor from the alcohol leaves a burn in the mouth.
title: Château Haut Prieur 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The over-exuberance of wood aging spoils this wine. With strong spice and equally tannic elements, it's all about the skeleton and not about the flesh of the fruit.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe and soft with a body of tannin that sits uneasily within this jammy character. The blend (Merlot 75%, Cabernet Franc 25%, Malbec 5%) was aged 30% in barrel and 70% in stainless steel tanks. It is unbalanced and likely to remain so.
title: Château Le Grand Moulin 2012 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Juicy and spicy flavors give a wine that layers fruit and ginger. Blackberries are the dominant fruit while the spice adds a bite that is almost exotic.
title: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This soapy, unfocused wine has tannins and red berry fruit but little structure. The fruit shows a green streak that will not improve.
title: Château des Tourtes 2011 Classic  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The fruity, perfumed character shows instant red berry aromas, but the old-wood flavor doesn't quite chime with the fruit, giving a slightly muddled feel to the wine.
title: Château Tour Saint-Germain 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Mint aromas speak of the wood used in aging this wine. With some burnt tannin character, it's perhaps not a wine that will show great fruit.
title: Château Haut Canteloup 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Earthy aromas are an off-putting start to this heavily tannic wine. It tastes bitter and extracted, the fruit worked too hard during fermentation.
title: Château Seguin 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Very dry and hard, with lean black currant fruits. This is likely to remain a tough and extracted wine.
title: Château Monconseil-Gazin 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine has an unusual candy-flavored character. Its tannins are fine, and there is structure, but the final character is unbalanced.
title: Château Tour Saint-Germain 2010 Elegance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A firm and tannic wine, with a hard-edge feel to it. The structure is dry and tough, leaving little room for the fruit, even in the future.
title: Château Saint-Urbain 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine has meaty aromas that lead into a bacon flavors. It has ample tannins but hardly any fruit.
title: Château Berthenon 2015 Cuvée Chloé  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dark chocolate and spice dominate this tough wine. The structure and extraction have smothered the fruit. Aging will be a hard call.
title: Château La Croix de Marsan 2016  Bordeaux

description: This soft, lightly tannic wine suggests red berries and a touch of spice. The wine is open and ready to drink.
title: Univitis 2016 L'Heritage du Marquis de Greyssac  (Bordeaux)

description: This shipper's blend is plump yet structured, boasting an herbal lattice of flavors draped over a base of black cherry and berry. Modest tannins and firm acidity provide grip to the finish
title: Yvon Mau 2002 Yvecourt  (Bordeaux)

description: There are aromas of ripe, juicy fruit. To taste, the wine is soft, juicy, and easy, perhaps slightly dilute. A very approachable wine, but in the end lightweight.
title: Château Bonnet 2000 Bordeaux Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a dry wine, more about structure than fruit. The tannins and the firm extraction shows strongly. It is not enjoyable.
title: Château Vieux Manoir 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a wine that has been spoiled by the over-use of wood aging. The fruit is still struggling to come through. It will be a tough call as to which wins.
title: Château Saintongey 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: Light and unfocused, this simple wine has fruit but misses out on structure and much interest.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2015 Château Buisson Redon  (Bordeaux)

description: It is a tough wine with too much wood for the fruit. Wood aromas show strongly in the taste as well. Some balance will come, but probably not enough.
title: Château Roques Mauriac 2015 Damnation  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is dry, firm and initially tough. With its dry wood core, the fruit is not getting a chance.
title: Château Haut Mondain 2014 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This fresh wine has plenty of acidity as well as some firm tannins. It is still young, waiting to fill out with riper fruit flavors. The aftertaste just repeats the acidity.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 La Tour du Gouverneur  (Bordeaux)

description: Tannins mask the light fruitiness in this blend of 45% Merlot, 45% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc. It seems extracted, with the producer attempting to get too much out of the fruit in a lean year.
title: Château Bellevue la Randée 2013  Bordeaux

description: This 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Franc blend is very fruity and fresh, balancing dry tannins and attractive red fruit flavors. It is light, still tight with its structure. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2013  Bordeaux

description: A light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. From the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, it has red berry fruits and juicy acidity. A greener, herbal character in the background suggests grapes that weren't totally ripe at harvest.
title: Château de Crain 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is a thin wine with way too much acidity for the fruit. The rest of the wine is dry tannin that could soften into a more juicy character. It's always going to be a light wine.
title: Léo de la Gaffeliére 2012  Bordeaux

description: Herbal aromas give a crisp character. The fruit is not entirely ripe, so the wine relies on its tannins and acidity to get balance.
title: Château Briot 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is a structured wine, with too many tannins from wood and fruit. The red berry fruits are likely always to remain second to the structure.
title: Ginestet 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is a lean wine that seems to be missing the fruit. It has an austere quality with a strongly tannic element and mineral acidity.
title: Château Roustaing 2012 Réserve Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and juicy, this smooth, simple wine is ready to drink. Juicy black currant fruits are polished by the wood aging.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2011  Bordeaux

description: A juicy wine, it has soft tannins and gently stalky fruit textures. Black currant fruits accompany fresh, tangy acidity. Not for aging, so drink now.
title: Château Belle-Garde 2012  Bordeaux

description: This wine seems rather unfocused with indistinct tannins and fruit. There is a soapy texture, and the red berry fruits seem awash with acidity.
title: Château Bernés 2011  Bordeaux

description: There is way too much acidity here, and it's exagerrated by the wine's soft, unfocused texture. Notes of bitter toast and dark tannins are rather unbalanced.
title: Château Ballan-Larquette 2011  Bordeaux

description: Dry, firmly structured and tough, this is an austere wine that doesn't hold out much hope for improvement. Drink it soon with rich food to balance out its dense tannins and wood flavors.
title: Château du Cros 2011  Bordeaux

description: Very young, fruity wine. The tannins are already soft and there is stalky black currant acidity that gives the wine a bright freshness. It has no wood and will develop fast.
title: Château Allégret 2012  Bordeaux

description: Dry and tannic initially, the wine opens up to reveal a soft, fruity character. It is still compact, with some bitterness from overextraction.
title: Vignobles Pueyo 2009 Tellus Vinea  (Bordeaux)

description: This lightweight wine is dominated by juicy red fruit. Fresh in character, it has bright acids and soft tannins. Not a wine for aging.
title: Château des Combes 2010  Bordeaux

description: This perfumed wine is tough on the palate. It has a firm, dry core, surrounded by red-currant-driven acidity. The finish is out of balance.
title: Château le Bergey 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a dense, wood- and tannin-laden wine. It's hard, with a dry and unyielding structure. In one year, it should be more generous.
title: Château Grands Bois 2009  Bordeaux

description: This has a tight, severe character, with black currant fruit and a touch of green bell pepper. It's stalky and structured, with a lean feeling.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2010  Bordeaux

description: A tight wine-this is on the lean side, but shows an attractive red-currant flavor and soft tannins. This is not meant for aging.
title: Château les Terrasses de Bouey 2009  Bordeaux

description: Taut, stalky wine, very structured. There is fruit but it is herbal, green, missing ripeness. The tannins have the same character.
title: Château Grand Jean 2010  Bordeaux

description: Very soft wine, with gentle berry fruit flavors, cinnamon and a light, ripe character. Black currant fruits emerge from the light texture with an attractive tannic layer.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2009  Bordeaux

description: This soft, wood- and blackberry-flavored wine shows spice alongside acidity. It has an edge of astringency and green herbs, but the vanilla from the wood does give it some weight and balance.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2006  Bordeaux

description: Lean, initially bitter, this is a firmly tannic wine. The berry fruits show freshness, but the dry tannins dominate. Of course, it's young, but the texture is too light for much development.
title: Château Darzac 2006 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A stalky Bordeaux from a vineyard north of Saint-Emilion. The fruit is austere and lean, with plenty of acidity. There are light tannins, and there is fresh fruit, but the core is missing.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2004  Bordeaux

description: Vanilla aromas and fresh red currant fruit flavors give this wine a freshness as well as a simple, easy structure. The acidity could be less dominant.
title: Yvecourt 2005  Bordeaux

description: There is a Rosé here struggling to get out. This wine has strawberry fruits combined with tannins in a way that does not work. Bordeaux Clairet lies between Rosé and red in color and in taste.
title: Château de Marsan 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Closed and tough, this wine has spent too long in wood. It offers little but spice and toast.
title: Château Saint Antoine 2016 Fleur Saint Antoine  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: High-toast flavors still dominate this wine, although they should by now have melded into the fruit. It suggests the wine will continue to have strong, bitter wood flavors.
title: Château Rouquette 2014 La Tour aux Palombes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is spoiled by overripe fruit. It has a juicy component as well as firm tannins, but that high-alcohol jammy character is not pleasant.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2016 Cuvée le Barry  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: lean, austere wine, that has dry tannins and flavors of stalky currants. It is pleasant enough, with some freshness, but there is a definite green element to it.
title: Château Trocard 2004  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This tough wine has overripe fruit. There are tough extracted tannins. It's a hard wine to like.
title: Château Beausoleil 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has a southern character with very ripe fruit that seems unbalanced for the tannins and acidity. It's an odd wine.
title: Château de Seguin 2015 Cuvée Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is tight and perhaps firm. Its extracted tannins and dry core are too much for the fruit.
title: Château Labatut 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Smoky aromas lead to a wine that is dominated by wood. It is about structure rather than fruit.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is dominated by extracted wood flavors. It is likely to soften, but not enough to allow the fruit to sing.
title: Château Bellevue Peycharneau 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is smoky and toasty. It is extracted with bitter coffee flavors that dominate the fruit. Too much burnt wood will leave little room for fruitiness.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is soft, full in the mouth while not having much focus.
title: Château de Sours 2014 La Source  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Toast aromas precede layers of wood flavors that give the wine a tough, dry, spicy character that masks the fruit.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2013 Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: With soft tannins and fresh fruits, this light, crisp wine has a red fruit-flavored character that is intense in its acidity. Drink now.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 Roc des Chevaliers  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There is probably too much wood aging in this wine. It's still young, but the dominant toastiness gives a burnt character. It has a hard edge, tough and very dry.
title: Producta Vignobles 2012 Château de Beaulieu  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is hard and tough, all tannins and extraction.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This tough wine seems light on fruit. It is hard and shows considerable extraction.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With a high proportion of Cabernet in the blend, this holds tough tannins. There is also juicy Merlot that offers an attractive, fruity future.
title: Domaine de Courteillac 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The fruit is extremely extracted, making for a wine that is tough, very firm and hard without the juicy character needed to see it through.
title: Château Damase 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a hard-edged wine with a chemical character. It's tough both in tannins and extracted fruits.
title: Château Belrose 2012 Cuvée Maucaillou  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Bread and yeasty aromas lead to a wine that has tannins and wood aging, leaving the fruitiness behind.
title: Château Larteau 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Bitter extraction hinders this wine. It does have some attractive fruitiness in the background, but it's lost amidst all the toughness. The rigid edge will soften, although the wine's fruitiness may well never materialize.
title: Château de Seguin 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is too toasty for its own good. It has dark tannins, high spice and bitter toastiness. There is a soapy aftertaste that only just hints at fruit.
title: Château de Camarsac 2011 Prince Noir  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Juicy and fruity, this wine has strong layers of acidity and extracted tannins. It has a hard, austere character that doesn't promise for the future.
title: Château du Lort 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This dark, extracted wine is firm in character. It has bitter coffee and licorice flavors, which rather elbow aside the fruit.
title: Château Croix de Gentis 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A hard and tannic wine, with too much dryness for pleasure. It's not likely to soften enough to balance out.
title: Domaine du Claouset 2011 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Hard and extracted, this wine shows little more than tannins. The fruitiness is hard to discern and may never come through.
title: Château Penin 2011 Les Cailloux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is all fruit and no structure. The fruit shows a superripe character, which suggests this is a wine for short-term aging.
title: Château Cluzan 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This warm wine is reminiscent of vintage Port. It is sweet, with dominating nut and superripe fruit flavors. It's soft and gently flabby.
title: Château Beau Rivage 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Juicy and fruity, this has ripeness without much structure. This is for early drinking.
title: Château de Bel 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a lightweight wine with fruit that tastes overripe. It has a soft, fruity texture, and its gentle tannins are touched by acidity.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Attractively made, but uncomplicated wine, with fresh raspberries, acidity, a light tannic coating, maybe spoilt by a rustic edge. Drink now.
title: Château Mirefleurs 2006  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine suffers from over-ripe fruit that give it a red-jelly flavor. The tannins and acidity make an odd contrast.
title: Château Clos Chaumont 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Strong wood flavors have smothered the fruit, leaving vanilla, spice and milk chocolate as the main flavors. Gérard Laurent blends 65% Cabernet Franc and 35% Malbec from biodynamic and organic vineyards in egg-shaped Apollo flexitanks where the wine matures for a year.
title: Château l'Escart 2012 Cuvée Puits du Roy  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Heavy toast aromas follow through to a wine that is packed with new wood and some fruit. It has a biting burnt edge that may soften.
title: Château Bourbon 2010 Clos Bourbon  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A confected wine that shows polished wood and mint flavors but little fruit. It puts on a great show, but without depth.
title: Château Brethous 2010 Prélude  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Lean and tough, this is all hard edges. The wine has an austere character that's likely to be off-putting even in the future.
title: Château Biac 2010 Félix de Biac  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Simple, light and leafy. Not a lot of oomph here. Some light, dry raspberry fruit and plenty of wood on the palate and finish. You gotta love your oak to really enjoy this one. It's kind of closed, and I wouldn't bet much on its future.
title: Château Mazeris 1996  Canon-Fronsac

description: This dark wine has extracted tannins and dark-coffee flavors. Its hard edge is probably not going to soften enough.
title: Château Montlandrie 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This lean wine, all acidity and tannins, has a severe character that is not likely to go away. The estate has been handed down from mother to daughter for seven generations and now owned by enologist Marie Laure Latorre. It was named for the Merlot plot planted on 08/11/99, the date of the last total solar eclipse seen in France.
title: Château le Sanctuaire 2012 L'Eclipse  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: There is a strongly rustic character to this wine. The fruit seems to have disappeared. and the wine is tough right through. Maceration took place in traditional concrete vats; malolactic fermentation and aging in barrels, 25% new oak.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With no added sulfites and from organically grown grapes, this bottling ventures into natural wine territory. However, it suffers from a tinny character that can affect these wines and shows some hints of volatility. The second bottle tasted was less volatile.
title: Château Langlais 2016 Les Bories de Langlais  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Soft, ripe and jammy, this is too ripe and misses structure. Its acidity does redeem it, but it is not going to develop much.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2012 Valentine par Valentine  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a spicy wine, soft and open. Its tannins and red berry fruits have a diffuse character that takes away the focus of the wine. It will age quickly.
title: Château Haut-Lansac 2010 Les Moulins du Haut-Lansac  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Very dry and with too much wood, this is an attenuated wine with a hard facade. It doesn't offer enough fruit for the future.
title: Château Noblet 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wine veers between firm tannins from old wood and red fruit acidity, without finding balance. It's very dry, with a hard edge.
title: Château Toumilon 2009  Graves

description: A lean, somewhat austere wine that emphasizes tight tannins and minerality. The fruit is firm, but at the same time both slightly oxidized and edging towards green. The result is a set of flavors that definitely demands food.
title: Château de Respide 2006  Graves

description: While this wine shows some of the softness and richness of 2003, it keeps a light touch and the acidity and black fruits remain fresh. There is an edge of astringency that leaves a hard aftertaste.
title: Château Toumilon 2003  Graves

description: This wine is all structure and dark, dry tannins. The fruit is very subdued, giving a hard wine that could well remain tough.
title: Château du Cartillon 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A very juicy wine that shows overripe fruit and an herbal character. It's soft, fruity without great definition and likely to develop quickly.
title: Château du Retout 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Juicy but not quite ripe, this is a green and herbal wine that is not worth aging. Drink it over the next few years.
title: Château Laride 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: With barnyard aromas, this is a rustic wine. It does have some red fruit flavors and acidity but these are compromised by the earthy texture.
title: Château Bonnin 2011 La Fleur Blanchon  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine is fruity but has a lean texture that emphasizes tannins rather than fruit. With a dry core and bitter-chocolate flavors, the wine misses out on the fruit.
title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Arnozan Réserve des Chartrons  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Spicy, foresty aromas dominate what subdued fruit there is. The palate is tight and grippy, with full-on tannins that really get after your cheeks. Amid those tannins is some grapey fruit and a bit of toastiness.
title: Château Canuet 1998  Margaux

description: Starts off with an herbal note that carries throughout. Blackberry, cassis, tar, spice and citrus flavors are in evidence as well. Tannins are a bit rustic. Kosher
title: Chateau Le Breuil Renaissance 2001  Médoc

description: Lean and tannic, this wine has chocolate and bitter coffee flavors from over-extraction. The fruit is suppressed at this stage, with a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château les Lattes 2013  Médoc

description: The wine is stalky with a green element that suggests underripe fruit. Black currant competes with burnt flavors that will soften as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2012  Médoc

description: Earthy aromas need time to blow away once this is opened. After that, the wine gives lean fruit, a tight and mineral stalkiness and high acidity. Bitter extraction cuts through the wine.
title: Château Bournac 2012  Médoc

description: This is a special selection from parcels of vines in Château Castéra. Stewed plum aromas lead to a wine that is lean, leaving little room for the fruit.
title: Château Castera 2012 Château Bourbon la Chapelle  (Médoc)

description: A rather soapy, wine, it does not have enough fruitiness to sustain its tannins. It's hard edged and likely to remain that way.
title: Château La Clare 2011  Médoc

description: Dry and light, an unfocused wine. It has tannins, only light fruit, very dry and ultimately tough.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2007  Médoc

description: Shows its Right Bank roots in Merlot and Cab Franc-derived red fruit and herb flavors: strawberry, tomato and rhubarb. Turns leathery and earthy, with some hints of toast on the finish.
title: Vieux Château Négrit 1997  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: A thin wine that is all dry tannins and not enough fruit. It is lightweight with just a hint of juiciness.
title: Château du Vallier 2007  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Definitely on a downward slope, this wine is very dry, the fruit gone and replaced by tannins. Drink now. Imported
title: Château du Vallier 2004  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This has plenty of tannins, but seems thin on the fruit. It gives an unbalanced wine that should have filled out by now. The texture is extracted with a hard edge.
title: Château Vieux Peyrouquet 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: A very dry, tannic wine, full of dense structure. The fruit can be found underneath all this dryness, a layer of hedgerow blackberries, tight and firm. At the end, there is some baked acidity.
title: Château Trimoulet 2003  Saint-Émilion

description: A hard, too-toasty wine that is completely dominated by smoky wood flavors. Whatever fruit is there is swamped, only a juicy hint through the wine's weight.
title: Château Cossieu-Coutelin 2011  Saint-Estéphe

description: Lean and earthy, but clean, and with an appealing freshness. Cherry and berry fruit dominates, and the finish is true. And there's even some patented Bordeaux herbaceousness, but in a good way. Kosher.
title: Verbau 2000  Bordeaux

description: This Kosher Bordeaux has woody, maple-like aromas along with some smoky, rubbery accents. The palate offers some cherry and cola flavors, while the finish is smooth enough, with pronounced woody notes.
title: Château Saint-Laurent 1999  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a light 100% Merlot wine, with tangy red berry fruits. Tight and mineral with high levels of acidity, it is not for aging, so drink now.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2013 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: Overripe fruit from a small experimental vineyard is the hallmark of this wine. The awkwardness is not helped by the extracted tannins.
title: Château Tertre de Belves 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Aromas of maple, black pepper and cherry cough drop get it going in a fair to midland direction. The palate is basic, with only some standard berry fruit and oak, while the finish is lengthy and easy, but also kind of mute. In terms of mouthfeel, some hard tannins prevent it from falling into the "friendly" category.
title: Château Les Rochers Mirande 2000  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is tight with tannins and a dry core. By contrast, the rest seems light and thin.
title: Château Terre Blanque 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Jammy strawberry flavors mark this ripe wine. The fruit is perhaps too mature, giving an unbalanced aftertaste.
title: Château la Bretonniére 2016 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The fruit seems too ripe in this wine, giving a jammy character surrounding a dry core. It could balance better in a few years.
title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Château Les Jouberts Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Jammy ripe fruit has become entangled with extracted tannins in this clumsy wine. Red-berry flavors are there but lack balancing acidity.
title: Château Haut Cluzeau 2016 La Révélation  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From a 17-acre Merlot-dominated vineyard, this is a dry wine, where the tannins dominate the fruit. The wine has a bitter edge from too much extraction. The hints of fruit are not quite enough.
title: Château des Tourtes 2014 Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This Merlot/Cabernet Franc blend is a tight closed wine showing tannins rather than fruit. It will remain this way.
title: Château les Grands  Maréchaux 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This Alliance Bourg wine is dry and firm with its concentrated tannins. Too much extraction has left a bitter character. It will remain a wine that is tough.
title: Château Haut Millet 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Shooting for wine that will age for at least 15 years, this has too much wood for its own good. Dark and spicy with tough toast, it will likely remain that way. Somebody tried too hard.
title: Château Berthenon 2014 Cuvée Chloé  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a lean wine, all tannins and missing fruit. It is dry and showing considerable hard extraction. It will soften, but not much.
title: Château les Berthets 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is all crisp red currants and acidity. Fresh, fruity and lightly textured, it is a wine to drink young, from 2016.
title: Château Haut-Bourcier 2013  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firm but with juicy fruit, this 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon blend is a solid, still young, wine. The aftertaste is tough and packed with acidity.
title: Château Haut Boilon 2013  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is concentrated, with fruit that seems too ripe. Jammy berry flavors are mixed in with dry tannins and a firm backdrop. It's solid, although not quite balanced. The estate was founded in 1967 by Philippe Raguenot; daughters Emmanuelle and Marie-Pierre took over in 1997.
title: Château des Tourtes 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Heavy wood aromas from new French oak barrels show equally strongly as dark chocolate flavors on the palate from this 50/50 Merlot/Malbec blend. The wine, tiny production from 2.5 acres, is all wood, very firm and tough. Only the acidity suggests a potential fruitiness. This estate has been in the Noël family since 1800.
title: Château Tour Saint-Germain 2012 Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Jammy fruits conflict with a firm tannic structure. This wine is not yet balanced and needs a lighter touch. Producer is Jean Paul Barre.
title: Château Saint-Urban 2013  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is soft and juicy with 12 months in barrel. It has rounded tannins and perfumed berry fruits. What it misses is the acidity, leaving an unbalanced wine.
title: Château Dubraud 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is perfumed, spicy with dense tannins. It has a hard-edged structure, tough with the ripe fruit still underneath. Vines are an average of 14 years old.
title: Château Les Grands Maréchaux 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This dry wine is strongly dominated by tannins. It is structured, firm and hard-edged. Without the fresh acidity at the end, it would be a tough proposition.
title: Château Saint-Urbain 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has some of the typical freshness of 2011 but it seems on the thin side. Black currant flavors run alongside high acidity, and the tannins show strongly. The aftertaste brings out more tight, mineral acidity.
title: Château la Petite Roque 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A firm, licorice-flavored wine, with bitter notes and a peppery character that shows through the fruit. It feels extracted and hot.
title: Philippe Raguenot 2011 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: High acidity cuts through this wine from the get-go. The tannins also show a hard edge. This is a wine for the future, always with a sense of austerity and minerality.
title: Château Grand Maréchaud 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Almost too fruity, the wine has red berry fruits in profusion. What is missing is the tannin to hold it together, making this a fruity wine to drink soon.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is lean, with a light texture that brings out juicy black fruit and intense acidity. It misses out on the concentration and richness of the vintage.
title: Château la Fleur Bellevue 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine's green, herbal character suggests underripe fruit. All bell pepper and spice flavors, the fruit seems left behind.
title: Château Cantinot 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: New wood aromas lead this toasty wine that has spice, high toast flavors and the smallest hint of fruit. If the producer had not been so enthusiastic with the oak, this could have been a good wine.
title: Château Les Bertrands 2015 Nectar Des Bertrands  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Heavily wood aged, this wine is tough and dry, with aggressive toast flavors. The concentration is there but is not from fruit.
title: Château Clairac 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dry, firm and tough, this wine lacks the fruit fruit to come through the structure. It's a wine for those who like plenty of wood.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Minty new wood aromas are the theme in this wood-laden wine. It has a burnt character from high extraction and wood aging, making it hard to discern the fruit, although there is a juicy character at the end.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2015 Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Spicy and smoky, this wine is dark with tannins and dryness. Its dark chocolate and bitter coffee flavors suggest tough extraction. The fruit does not stand a chance.
title: Château Bellevue 2015 Amphorae  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Light and fruity, this gently structured wine offers spice and wood flavors. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Les Graves de Barrau 2016  Bordeaux

description: One of the brands produced by this large cooperative, this rich wine has an odd earthy character that is less appealing. It is ready to drink.
title: Univitis 2016 Rocheterrier  (Bordeaux)

description: Red berry fruits dominate this young wine. While it has a firm structure, the attractiveness of the fruit and acidity give it the potential to age quickly. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Haut Clary 2016  Bordeaux

description: This wine is soft, fruity and likely to be ready to drink soon. Its red fruits and acidity are already attractive. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Franc Couplet 2016  Bordeaux

description: This soft, jammy wine does not have much structure. It will develop quickly, giving red-berry flavors and acidity.
title: Château la Petite Borie 2016  Bordeaux

description: This is a tight, acid and black-currant-fruited wine. Still young, it has firm tannins and a bitter edge that needs to blow away. Drink from 2019.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2016 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)

description: Malesan is the bestselling Bordeaux brand in France, and this wood-aged version shows the French have got it right. With the quality of the 2000 vintage to help it along, it is ripe, packed with black currant flavors and ripe acidity plus just a touch of wood. Anybody in Bordeaux should visit the Malesan cellar, which is like a football ground, with the tasting room set out on a stage in the central pitch, surrounded by tiers of barrels instead of spectators.
title: Malesan 2000 Rouge Wood  (Bordeaux)

description: Quite herbal, with some green beans and anise up front. Black fruit takes a back seat but is there if you look for it. Blackberry and beach plums come to mind. The tannins are a bit rustic. Kosher
title: Mouton-Cadet 2000  Bordeaux

description: Currently this wine is much too dominated by wood. There is some dark, tarry fruit, but the wood is ever-present. Buy this wine if you like wood flavors, the question is whether the fruit is powerful enough to come through.
title: Château Lestrille Capmartin 2000 Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Smells plummy and ripe but tastes of bright cherries and shows a lean, claret-style mouthfeel. It's a little thin, but still manages to provide pleasure. Finishes with tasty mocha and toast shadings.  White Wine
title: Malesan 1999 Fierte de Malesan  (Bordeaux)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Malbec produced only in good vintages, this year's Verdillac is light but charming. It begins with earthy, blackberry and smoke aromas, and while the tannins are pretty fierce, there's some underlying good fruit. The finish is bitter and requires rich foods.
title: Armand Roux 1999 Verdillac  (Bordeaux)

description: There are soft grapefruit-peach aromas and flavors, tart lime notes and a medium body here. It's not complex, but it's not supposed to be. It has no bad marks at all, and even a little length to show. A good bar pour or gallery opener.
title: Calvet 1998  Bordeaux

description: Straightforward, perhaps even simple, but once again well-made inexpensive juice. At 80% Merlot, it is soft with berry and hint of tobacco predominating. The light fruit has pleasant cocoa shadings, and it has a poised finish with mild tannins.
title: Calvet 1998  Bordeaux

description: Dry and structured, the wine has a way to go before the fruit shows. It is over-extracted giving a hard bitter edge. Give the fruit a chance and wait until mid 2018.
title: Château La Rose Gadys 2015  Bordeaux

description: Firmly structured, the wine is dry and with dark tannins. Its fruit is currently masked. Give it until late 2017.
title: Maison Hebrard 2015 Château des Trois Tours  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is rich and packed with superripe blackberry fruits. While there is acidity to keep the wine crisp, it does have a heavy feel to it from the high alcohol that also brings a pepper edge. Drink from 2018.
title: Chateau Malbat 2015  Bordeaux

description: Firm with tannins, this is a dry wine. Its tough structure dominates the berry fruit, needing time to balance out. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Guitar 2015  Bordeaux

description: The tannins and high toast flavors have taken over this wine. The fruit has been submerged. It is difficult to see this completely balancing out.
title: Château Malbat 2015 C'est la Vie!  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a ripe wine, mainly from Merlot, showing fruit that is jammy and almost sweet. With attractive acidity to balance, it is soft, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Cordier 2015 Enjoy la Vie  (Bordeaux)

description: From vines in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, the wine is fresh, fruity and light. It has red-currant flavors that are bright and crisp. It's perfumed by the Cabernet Franc that dominates the blend. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Roustaing 2015 Réserve Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is dry, firm and with too many tannins for its own good. It does have hints of fruit along with spice and acidity. Shame about the over extraction that gives it a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château le Sépe 2014  Bordeaux

description: Initially a little rustic, the wine does open out. It is smoky, fruity with the acidity of the vintage.
title: Château Briot 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a structured, firm wine that has tense tannins and acidity. It is smoky with a dry core. The fruit is just not there.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is spicy and laden with wood. It has an extracted character that produces chocolate and bitter coffee flavors. The fruit is hard to find at this stage.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2014  Bordeaux

description: This red-currant and red-berry flavored wine is bright and fruity. It does have some wood-aging flavors that add spice and a dry edge. The juicy acidity at the end keeps it all fresh.
title: Château Joinin 2014  Bordeaux

description: An homage to the classic French mustache (rarely see now), this is an amusing label interpretation of simple, fruity Bordeaux. It has plenty of black-currant fruits and a lightly stalky texture that balances the crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Falgueyret Leglise 2014 Monsieur Moustache  (Bordeaux)

description: Light in color, the wine is equally light in flavor-a soft, gentle wine with only hints of tannins. Fruity without much depth, it is ready to drink, .
title: Château Fonfroide 2013  Bordeaux

description: This soft, ready-to-drink wine is all about black-currant fruitiness, with only the lightest of tannins. Juicy, fresh acidity finishes an attractive wine.
title: De Luze 2014 Cuvée Fashion  (Bordeaux)

description: This soft, jammy and fruity wine is ready to drink, with black-currant flavors that are ripe and rounded. Only the lightest tannins gives any structure to this wine that is immediately accessible.
title: Château les Joyeuses 2014  Bordeaux

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this soft wine has red fruits that miss much definition, only hinting at some stalky acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Le Roi Pépin  (Bordeaux)

description: From the east of the Bordeaux region, this light and juicy wine has attractive, forward acidity and the gentlest of tannins. Fresh and fruity, it is ready to drink.
title: Château Caville 2014  Bordeaux

description: This wine has attractive fruit, crisp acidity and a good balance with the light tannic structure. Bright and fresh wine, it is ready to drink. This is one of the Ducourt family properties on the Right Bank of Bordeaux.
title: Château la Rose du Pin 2013  Bordeaux

description: Crisp raspberry flavors give this Barthe family wine an attractive fruitiness and acidity. It is light on the palate, still tight and needs a few more months. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la Freynelle 2013  Bordeaux

description: This wine is fruity, with only a light texture of acidity and stalky black currant fruit flavors. From the difficult 2013 vintage, it is lit with acidity and fresh fruit at the end. Drink now. The d'Arfeuille family is in its fifth century on Bordeaux's Right Bank.
title: Château Tessendey 2013  Bordeaux

description: This wine is full of acidity as much as red fruits. Crisp, tight and with freshness from the red currant fruits, it is ready to drink. This is one of the Vignobles Jean Queyrens et Fils wineries.
title: Château Pilet 2013  Bordeaux

description: While this wine has a strong tannic structure, it also offers plenty of ripe fruit. Acidity is kept in its place, giving freshness allied to warm berries. Drink this attractive wine from 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 Mission St. Vincent  (Bordeaux)

description: Forward red fruits give a good beginning to this light and fruity blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. It is crisp with red currant flavors and layers of acidity. Drink now.
title: Univitis 2013 Château Les Vergnes  (Bordeaux)

description: Light, ripe and fruity, this wine is bursting with black currant fruits supported by a firm base of dry fruit tannins. It can be drunk now in its youth, but will be better from 2016.
title: Château Grand Jean 2014  Bordeaux

description: Still dominated by wood and toast aromas, this wine is certainly too young to drink. The wood needs to smooth out and allow room for the fruit. It will age, with its fresh fruits and acidity, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Jean de Bel Air 2014  Bordeaux

description: Pure fruitiness, this wine is full of black currant flavors and a stalky, dusty texture. Without wood aging, it has acidity, fruitiness and some dry tannins. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château Haut Vieux Chêne 2014  Bordeaux

description: The 56 acres of this estate are in the heart of the Entre deux Mers region. This young and fruity wine has stalky black currant fruits and fresh acidity. There's a light touch of spicy wood and a crisp, red fruit aftertaste.
title: Château Guillebot Plaisance 2013  Bordeaux

description: This is a light, obviously wood-aged wine. Black currant fruitiness is right up front along with a spicy, toasty character. That wood will integrate shortly with the acidity to give a fruity, friendly wine.
title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Château Reynaud Lacoste  (Bordeaux)

description: Light and fruity, this red berry, stalky flavored wine is crisp with acidity and soft tannins. It's developing fast and will be ready to drink from 2015.
title: Esprit de Gombeauds 2012  Bordeaux

description: Fresh, light and juicy, this wine is ready to drink. Lively and crisp, it has such soft tannins and fresh acidity. There is little in the way of structure or potential, so drink now.
title: Château de la Bouyére 2012  Bordeaux

description: The wine is all about juicy fruit, only lightly hinting at a structure. It's immediately attractive wine and ready to drink now.
title: Château Larroque 2012  Bordeaux

description: Stalky black currant fruits dominate this wine. It has acidity, juicy fruitiness and a dry, tight aftertaste. It's not for long aging.
title: Château les Terrasses de Bouey 2012  Bordeaux

description: Full of red berry fruits, this has some attractive fresh acidity to add to the light, bright feel. With its soft aftertaste, it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Lauduc 2012 Classic  (Bordeaux)

description: With toasty aromas and flavors, this wine is all about smoky burnt wood, only hinting at a fruity future. Keep it until 2016, although the wood is not going away.
title: Château Joinin 2012  Bordeaux

description: The wine is perfumed, structured and showing strong wood aging flavors. It lacks fruit, giving a tough character and leaving a highly aromatic aftertaste.
title: Grand Bourgeau 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Light and fresh, this is crisp and ready to drink. With the lightest of tannins, it's more about juicy fruitiness with a bright aftertaste.
title: Les Allées de Moron 2012  Bordeaux

description: This aromatic wine is at the same time structured and tough. Its redeeming feature is the berry fruit layer that is waiting to show through from 2015.
title: VIgnobles Ducourt 2012 Réserve de la Famille  (Bordeaux)

description: Red berry fruits are right up front in this juicy, fruity wine without great sense of structure. No matter, it's attractive and fresh now, ready to drink.
title: Producta Vignobles 2012  Bordeaux

description: The wine is rounded and soft with attractive berry fruits and wood aging. It's fruity with juicy acidity, black currant freshness and a dry core that will allow it to age 2017-2018.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a wood-laden wine, dense and firmly tannic. It's an unnecessarily tough proposition for a young Bordeaux, but the juicy black currant acidity could bring it round by 2017-2018.
title: Château Tour Chapoux 2012  Bordeaux

description: This offers black currant flavors and firm, stalky tannins. It has acidity, a good juicy character and a dry aftertaste. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Cagnas 2012  Bordeaux

description: A soft, perfumed wine, it shows attractive light black currant flavors as well as some tannins, acidity and a young fruity character. It is ready to drink now.
title: Fleury 2012 Ilixens  (Bordeaux)

description: A wine that veers between thin and acid and firmer tannins. It lacks the fruit weight to cope with its structure, so the wine will always be lean.
title: Château Haut Pasquet 2012  Bordeaux

description: The wine feels light and very soft. There are some attractive red berry fruits, along with acidity and wood flavors, but the tannic structure is hardly there. It's an enjoyable, lightweight wine to drink now through 2016.
title: Cheval Quancard 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A soft, rather soapy wine, it displays light fruits and gentle tannins. It is unfocused, with just some juicy aftertaste to give some interest.
title: Château Bellevue 2011  Bordeaux

description: Burnt toast aromas don't exactly make this wine attractive. The palate is better because it has fruit weight, but notes of heavily toasted wood and dry tannins dominate for now. It should improve with age, but will always have this element of hardness.
title: Château Malbec 2011  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a simple, easy wine with red berry fruits and soft tannins. It has lively fruitiness that is enjoyable now.
title: Château Vieil Orme 2011  Bordeaux

description: Structure keeps this firm, dry wine solidly closed. It is tightly wound at this stage, only hinting at a brighter, fruity future. Drink after 2015.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2011  Bordeaux

description: Burnt toast aromas don't exactly make this wine attractive. The palate is better because it has fruit weight, but notes of heavily toasted wood and dry tannins dominate for now. It should improve with age, but will always have this element of hardness.
title: Château Malbec 2011  Bordeaux

description: This wine is acidic beyond its other elements. It has a green, herbal character that suggests unripe fruit. It will soften with age, but will always be overtly brisk in nature.
title: Maison Sichel 2011 Sirius  (Bordeaux)

description: A balanced wine, showing attractive fruitiness, ripe black currants and soft tannins. It's likely to be ready to drink soon.
title: Vinum Natura 2011  Bordeaux

description: A solid wine, full of dried fruits, dense plums and firm tannins. It has fresh acidity, bright juiciness that will come through more strongly over the next few months.
title: Château le Mayne Turon 2011  Bordeaux

description: A firm, dry wine with good fruit, featuring touches of blackberry along with a solid tannic core. It's a wine for the medium-term, say 2-4 years.
title: Château de la Bouyére 2011  Bordeaux

description: This wood-aged wine bases its smooth character on firm tannins as much as fruit. It has concentration, firm extraction and a hard edge.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2011 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux)

description: Light and already fruity, this wine features attractive black-currant flavors, bright acidity and soft tannins. Ready to drink.
title: Château Roustaing 2011  Bordeaux

description: Going more for stalky tannins, this is a youthful, but also austere wine. It has perfumed wood along with hints of black currant tightly encased in a severe outer shell.
title: Château Terre Blanque 2011  Bordeaux

description: Attractive red fruits and soft tannins make this ripe, lightly structured wine easy to drink. There are hints of herbs and red berry fruits, with a touch of dryness on the finish. Drink now.
title: Château de Sours 2010 La Fleur d'Amélie  (Bordeaux)

description: With a blackberry flavor and a juicy character, this is a wine that has a bright, fresh feel and soft tannins.
title: Château Chaubinet 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a toasty, black-currant-fruited wine. Its structural tannins give a dry character. A touch of green herb and a hard edge of toast indicate that the wine needs another year to soften.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2010 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: A textured wine, this has ripe fruit that still shows a green, herbal character. It has weight and a ripe black-currant flavor, plus juicy acidity and soft tannins. Ready to drink.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Maison Magrez  (Bordeaux)

description: This exhibits stalky fruit, with some weight behind it. A black currant flavor dominates, with a ripe, jammy feel. For short-term aging.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2011  Bordeaux

description: This attractive, fruity wine has soft tannins and a texture that is dominated by spice and fruit notes and acidity. It has a juicy red-cherry finish.
title: Château Garrineau 2009  Bordeaux

description: In this toasty wine, the wood smothers the fruit and adds a burnt character. It feels austere, not one to easily reveal its treasures.
title: Château Pasquet 2010  Bordeaux

description: In this hard-edged wine, structure precludes the fruit from surfacing. There is a black currant element, but the tannins are likely to always dominate this firm, austere selection.
title: Château Beauregard-Ducourt 2010  Bordeaux

description: Surprisingly lightweight for the vintage, this is a red fruit-flavored wine, with tannins, acidity and a fresh aftertaste. Not for aging.
title: Château Moulin Lafitte 2009  Bordeaux

description: Produced by the largest Bordeaux cooperative, this is a freshly fruity wine, with simple red fruit flavors and soft tannins. There is a smoky edge and pink raspberry acidity.
title: Univitis 2009 Chevalier de Saint-André  (Bordeaux)

description: Soft, lightweight wine, with gentle tannins and a thin fruit character. There is plenty of acidity to give freshness. Drink now.
title: Château Dame Jane 2010  Bordeaux

description: Simply fruity Bordeaux. It has signs of wood and black currant fruit along with acidity and a light layer of tannin. Drink now.
title: De Mour 2008 Prince Rubis  (Bordeaux)

description: The Chartrons is the neighborhood of Bordeaux where the wine merchants traditionally worked. This branded Bordeaux is softly ripe, with an attractive density along with a dry core of tannins. Ready to drink now.
title: Maison Duhard 2009 Baron des Chartrons  (Bordeaux)

description: Soft, light fruit, packed with red cherries and fresh berries, is the star. The tannins are a mere hint, so the wine should be enjoyed soon for its attractive juiciness.
title: Château Denisiane 2009  Bordeaux

description: This wood-laden wine has light berry fruit and burnt toast flavors. The acidity cuts through, offering a glimpse of stalky black currant flavors.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Bordeaux

description: Soft, stalky black berry fruits, dry with a firm edge of tannins. The spice shows through along with final acidity.
title: Château de Virecourt 2008  Bordeaux

description: Fresh, perfumed wine, with cherry flavors. The acidity is pure, crisp with only light tannins and a green stalky final taste.
title: Château Grand Jean 2008  Bordeaux

description: The ludicrously heavy bottle must have cost more than the pleasant, fruity wine inside. The wood aging has had the effect of rounding the red berry fruits, while the juicy acidity points up freshness.
title: Vincent Saincrit 2005  Bordeaux

description: A ripe, juicy well-made, branded Bordeaux, its tannins tight but just right for the meaty chocolate flavors, spiced with wood. The acidity gives sweetness as much as freshness.
title: Yvon Mau 2006 Premius  (Bordeaux)

description: Light-bodied wine, with fresh spice and stalky tannins. There is bright black currant acidity, giving an edge to the wood perfumes.
title: Château de Fontenille 2007  Bordeaux

description: This is an earthy, rustic wine with simple black fruits and acidity. Developing fast, it is ready to drink with its berry flavors, soft tannins and crisp aftertaste.
title: Château de Cappes 2015  Bordeaux

description: A smooth, spice and red-berry flavored wine, this is soft, with an almost sweet aftertaste. It is light, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Monsieur de Bordeaux 2015 Merlot-Cabernet  (Bordeaux)

description: Stalky black currant fruit aromas and a spicy, stalky character on the palate define this tight, dry wine. It's young and tough now, so give it another year and drink from 2018.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2016 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A blend of 65% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Cabernet Franc, this is a medium-bodied Bordeaux for everyday drinking. The understated black cherry and cassis fruit does seem a bit lean, but that's the vintage. Tobacco notes mark the finish.
title: Mouton-Cadet 2007  Bordeaux

description: A simple fruity Bordeaux, attractively layering black currants, firm and dry tannins and fresh, juicy acidity. It's light, already drinkable. Screwcap.
title: Château la Mouliniére 2006  Bordeaux

description: Solid, wood-flavored tannins give this wine a good, smooth texture. Flavors of red cherries dominate what is an attractively fruity wine.
title: Premius 2005  Bordeaux

description: A young, very fruity wine produced by Christian Moueix. It is structured, firm and juicy, layered with dry tannins, probably needing 6-12 months of aging. A touch of pepper, red currants, toast and acidity complete this good, very Bordeaux, wine.
title: Christian Moueix 2005 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: A lean, somewhat austerely tannic wine, with dry tannins. The fruit is subdued, and there are hints of stalky black currant, disappointing from such a famous name. It could work with steak, when the acidity will cut through the meat.
title: Mouton-Cadet 2004  Bordeaux

description: With plenty of acidity and tannins, this wine is almost trying to be a young red. Drink it like that with food and it will be worth it. The aftertaste has pepper and attractive spice.
title: Château de Marsan 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Dark pink in color, this full wine offers tannins as well as crisp red fruits, giving it structure and a firm texture. The wine blends nearly all Bordeaux grapes: Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink it chilled, like a Rosé.
title: Château Landereau 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: This producer was over-enthusiastic with wood aging. The wine is all about high toast, giving little space for the fruit. That lack of balance may not change.
title: Château Bois Malot 2016 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine holds fruit that was too ripe, giving a clumsy character. It has structure as well as bright acidity, but the wine is spoiled by the jamminess.
title: Château Pertignas 2016 Cuvée de Copains  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A generous use of wood aging has given this wine a caramel flavor that lies awkwardly alongside the berry fruits. The aftertaste is dry.
title: Château Lamothe Castera 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is still a young wine, firm with tannins. The enthusiastic wood aging shows strongly in the smoky toasty flavor. It's hard to find the fruit.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015 Cuvée Les Tourelles  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Layered tannins and wood flavors have tended to smother the fruit in this wine. That gives a dry, tough character not promising much for the future.
title: Château Laville 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has too much wood. Tannins and spice as well as toast are present, but not enough fruit.
title: Château Grand Pascaud 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Situated in the heart of the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this estate has a long history dating back to the Middle Ages. With its stalky black currant fruit and acidity, this is fruity with a cool edge and a crisp edge. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Pey de Faure 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Strawberry fruit flavors dominate this soft wine. It is unfocussed and misses out on clarity and shape.
title: Château la Mothe du Barry 2014 Cuvée Design  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A wood-flavored wine that shows high toast and a burnt character. It has acidity and some fruit tannins although the fruit itself is missing. The result is a wine that will end up austere and with too much wood flavor.
title: Château Julian 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Black currants and spice give this wine its main aromatic character. On the palate, it's light with a dry core that is still dominant. The wine is more about structure and will probably stay that way.
title: Château Haut Laulion 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is structured and stalky without the fruit weight, reflecting the difficult vintage. A smoky character comes through the acidity to leave a dry aftertaste. Through 2016, it will soften a little, although always missing the fruit. The blend is 55% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Ssauvignon and 20% Cabernet Franc.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a fruity wine with red berry flavors and fresh acidity. It is crisp, light and ready to drink, with an attractive smoky aftertaste.
title: Château Lauduc 2013 Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Soft, light and juicy, this is a fresh, strawberry-flavored wine. It has only the lightest tannic structure, with plenty of acidity and bright red fruits. This Ginestet wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Bel Air 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While this wine is big on acidity, it does offer ripe, fresh blackberries and currants along with a firmer tannic background. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Parenchére 2013 Cuvée Raphael  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Smoky aromas lead to a palate with firm tannins and a dry, extracted character. All this masks the fruit for the moment, but let the flavors develop over the next few months, to mid-2016.
title: Château Queyssard 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This firm, smoky wine with fine tannins and ripe fruit is developing well, allowing the berry fruits to come through the structure. Give this wine until late 2016.
title: Château Laronde Désormes 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Too much extraction has given this wine a dry character. It does have juicy red fruits underneath and these should come out as the wine ages. It is likely, though, always to be a dry wine.
title: Château Barreyre 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is tight and austere. It still shows the smoky wood aging that has left a bitter chocolate character in the wine. It should soften, although it will likely end up lean. The blend is 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château Taussin 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Soft, juicy and ready to drink with its berry fruits and rounded tannins, it's an open wine, with only a light tannin character.
title: Château Trocard les Chapelles 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is tough with an obvious wood aging character. At the same time, it has a generous potential, full of ripe black fruits. Together they mean a wine that will need some time, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Tour d'Auron 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Tight tannins mark this wine. It does have an attractive red fruit layer, although it feels light on fruit and heavy on tannins.
title: Château Sainte Marie 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This structured wine is slow to show its fruity side although it has a layer of acidity with hints of black fruits. It is firm and dry at the moment with dense tannins and a dark aftertaste. Wait until 2017.
title: Lestonnat 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This has a curious caramel aroma from the wood aging. It's tough and extracted, a powerhouse of hard tannins without enough fruit.
title: Château Bel-Air 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is fruity, although somwhat direct in character. It has structured tannins and juicy yet indistinct black fruits.
title: Château Beaulieu Comtes de Tastes 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a wine that's on the lean side. That gives it structure without enough fruit to balance. It is dry, tight and shows black currant acidity at the end.
title: Château La Fleur Beaumont 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The 2004 vintage is certainly mature, but with a light touch it is still attractive to drink. Mushroom and spice are lifted by juicy acidity. The dryness at the end shows it is ready to drink.
title: Château Thuron 2004 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine feels hard with bitter extraction that detracts from its fruitiness. There is a very dense texture that could soften over time, although bitterness could remain a problem.
title: Château de Monrecueil 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dry and heavily extracted, this wine has fruitiness that is fleeting. It's a tough wine, but there is just a touch of juiciness on the finish.
