title: Château Latour-Laguens 2011 Cadette de Latour-Laguens  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine has a lean side that takes away from the bright acidity and fruitiness. With its berry fruit flavors, it should be rich, but lacks a middle.
title: Château Haut Nadeau 2011 Réserve du Propriétaire  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: With light toast aromas, this is a wine that shows vanilla from wood aging more than its fruitiness. There is a barnyard edge to it that brings out rusticity. On the finish, acidity does bring some freshness.
designation: Le Grand Rossignol du Château Lamothe Vincent
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011 Le Grand Rossignol du Château Lamothe Vincent  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A solid and concentrated wine, with burnt wood, bitter extraction and only a hint of blackberry fruit for the long term.
title: Château de Camarsac 2011 Vieilles  Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This dry, darkly tannic wine is all about structure and firmness. It has weight, but the fruit is submerged under the wood and the solid tannins.
title: Château Maréchaux 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With new wood aromas, this is a toast-dominated wine. The burnt character dominates fruit, leaving a bitter taste. It's likely to remain oaky and dry.
title: Château Vergnes Beaulieu 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: No Bordeaux should clock in at 15% alcohol, and this wine shows its power in extracted tannins and licorice flavor. Its acidity helps to mitigate the heat, but the flavor of black plum juice is heavier than the structure.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Should Bordeaux be 14%? Maybe, but not this wine. It is too big, dry, tannin-dominated and heavy. There is way too much extraction, and it shows in the bitter character.
title: Château de Parenchére 2009 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: As its 14.5% indicates, this is a particularly rich wine. Maybe too rich, because it is all superripe black fruit without the balance of structure or acidity. Enjoy it as a blockbuster, probably not with food.
title: Château Cadillac 2009 Cuvée J.J. Lesgourges  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A dark-hued wine, the tannins from fruit and wood dominating the fruit and giving a tendency to dry out. It could develop, although the tight structure does not help.
title: Château Julian 2009 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Soft and open fruit, flavors of black currants, rhubarb and fresh acidity. The tannins are light, the wine attractively balanced with a juicy aftertaste.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2007  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A soft, fruity wine lacking great depth, but with attractive red berry fruits and light tannins. It is bright, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Château Soussac 2007  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: An austere, stalky wine, showing its dry tannins and woody black currant flavors. It has a bitter edge to it, with its lean, dry tannins.
title: Mähler-Besse 2008 Château Biré  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Very light, just hinting at tannins, this is an easy, soft wine, the black berry juice fruit flavors the main taste element. The wine has a jammy, smoky character that comes through, but the texture remains dilute.
title: Château de Goëlane 2006  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine seems to have superripe fruits that have given it an unbalanced character. It shows acidity and firm tannins but lacks fruit.
title: Château de Fontenille 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Made from organic grapes, this wine offers red fruits and vibrant acidity with only 8% oak give this wine a light character. Its juicy fruitiness is not fully integrated with the tannins, but that should improve over the next year. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Brethous 2016 Classique  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a dry wine, firm with tannins and perhaps missing the fruit element. It has a dry core along with acidity. The future will leave it still on the dry side.
title: Château Chatard 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is soft, just juicy and with little in the way of concentration. Barrel-aged for 12 months in one-third new oak, it is attractive and ready to drink now. Vines are planted on limestone and clay above limestone and iron schist subsoil.
title: Château Clos Bourbon 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon wine is soft and juicy but without much character. Red fruits and acidity leave little more room for development. Aged 12 months in older oak barrels.
title: Château Clos Bourbon 2012 Cuvée La Rose Bourbon  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a herbal wine with fruit that is firm and austere. It has spice, a touch of wood, berry fruits and dry tannins. It seems on the lean side.
title: Château La Rame 2011 Charmille  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is ripe, yet with a line of green acidity and touches of bell pepper.
title: Château du Biac 2010 B de Biac  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Smoky aromas from wood aging show again strongly in the tough wooden plank notes that dominate this wine. It's a shame, because the fruit is there.
title: Château les Guyonnet 2015 Cuvée Héritage  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Now definitely mature, even drying up, this wine needs to be drunk now. It has developed a dry, tannic character, woody and stalky, although its balance is still there and the aftertaste has some juiciness.
title: Château Roullet 2007  Canon-Fronsac

description: Rich, but edging toward rustic, with its mature leather and berry fruits, topped by dry tannins. It is firm and smoky, in a very old style.
title: Château Tour Canon 2005  Canon-Fronsac

description: This wine is totally dominated by wood flavors, giving a hard, bitter edge that will need several years to soften, if at all. The fruit is hard to discern.
title: Château Ampélia 2017  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Perfumed new-wood flavors from a variety of toasts are strong in this wine. Tight tannins mask the fruit and probably always will. Less extraction and more fruit would have been good.
title: Château Roque le Mayne 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine has fruit but it is overwhelmed by the darkly tannic structure. It is concentrated and dense, with signs of extraction giving a hard edge. The Aubert family has been on the Bordeaux Right Bank for two centuries and currently owns six estates. Consulting oenologist is Michel Rolland.
title: Château Lagrave Aubert 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firm, tannic and hard, this tight wine has a solid core of dry wood. It seems over-extracted with its bitter coffee flavors. Fruit is hard to come by, although there is weight that could develop.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2012 Cuvée Compostelle  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This 100% Merlot from a small experimental vineyard is solid, firm and still young. It has a dense structure of tannins and wood aging, showing bitter coffee flavors and an austere character after 14 months in new French oak. It will likely remain a tough proposition.
title: Château Tertre de Belvés 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With too much smoky toast, this gives a hard, extracted feel with licorice rather than fruit. Tannins are dense and hints of juicy fruitiness only appear in the background.
title: Château de Monbadon 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A minty, modern style of wine that also has too much extraction and wood tannin for its own good. It's hard edged, the fruit losing out in the process.
title: Château Terrasson 2010 Cuvée Prévenche  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is marked by dry tannins and is smoky and toasty, with little sign of fruit. While it will soften, it will stay somewhat tough.
title: Domaine de l'Aurage 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Jammy, overripe fruit does not help this wine. Its soft tannins and acidity provide some pleasure, but that clumsy fruit gets in the way.
title: Château de Belcier 2015 Le Pin de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins and overripe fruit dominate this wine. It will not develop well, with those tannins remaining tough.
title: Château Bourron 2015 Le Belvédére de Bourron  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Overripe, jammy fruit aromas and flavors spoil this wine. It's oddly balanced: soft on the one hand and tough on the other.
title: Château German 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine's strawberry jam aromas lead to a palate dominated by tannins. It's dry and missing fruit.
title: Château de Belcier 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe, juicy and jammy wine with red plum and soft berry flavors. The name means "Tame the Beast" but the wine is not fully balanced and probably will never be.
title: Château de Cranne 2016 Dompter la Bête  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This 60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc blend has ripe red fruits and soft tannins that give a broad feel. It is ready to drink now.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2012  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A fresh and fruity wine, with black currant notes, yet somewhat stalky in character. The aftertaste is bright and light.
title: Château Anniche 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a dark, firm wine, its fruit only showing slowly. The tannins are powerful and dominate the wine. It feels slightly underripe in character.
title: Château le Doyenne 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This lean wine is high on acidity and structure. The fruit seems to be missing, needing more flesh to feel complete.
title: Château Haut-Rian 2015 Tradition  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Spicy and oaky, with aromatic notes of plum, cassis and pepper. The snappy palate offers cherry, currant and plum flavors, while the finish is tight-grained and oaky. Although lean and not terribly deep, what's here is largely satisfying.
title: Château Gravettes-Samonac 1999  Cotes de Bourg

description: The wine is lean for the vintage, tight and with an austere structure. Its tannins and juicy red fruits are in the background. The aftertaste is dry and firm.
title: Château Kalon Nodoz 2012 Carpe Diem  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: The wine has layers of acidity that come from the underripe fruit. It has bell pepper and spice along with red currant fruitiness.
title: Château Kalon Nodoz 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: The wine has the lightness of the vintage. It has spice, red-currant fruits and hints of not-quite-ripe grapes. The wine is developing fast and will be ready from 2017.
title: Château Tour de Cazelle 2013  Cotes de Bourg

description: Heavily dominated by wood aging, this wine should be showing its fruit by now, but isn't. It has bitterness, layers of spice and smoky wood. Only the aftertaste brings some freshness and acidity.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: The wine does have fruit, but it is masked by strong burnt tannins from the wood aging. The acidity shows the possibility of red berry fruits appearing later.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: A soapy textured wine that misses any focus. There are soft red berry fruits, gentle tannins and some juicy acidity. But it is just dull.
title: Château Tour de Cazelle 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: Fine-grained tannins course through this wine. It has good juicy currant fruits along with acidity. It feels lightweight, without great concentration, but is certainly immediately attractive.
title: Château Roquevieille 2008  Cotes de Castillon

description: An earthy, barnyard wine with soft tannins and red fruits, this is juicy and has plenty of acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Puygueraud 2016  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has very ripe fruit that leaves a jammy character. Merlot sweetness dominates and the wine seems unbalanced maybe the result of recent bottling.
title: Château Ad Francos 2014 Château le Priolat  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A hard-edged wine, all bitter tannin and dark extraction. It's hard to tell whether the fruit, if any, will struggle through.
title: Château Marsau 2010  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine seems lean, severe with plenty of tannins but not yet enough fruitiness. There are hints of black currants and definitely plenty of acidity. The dry extraction leaves a wine that's gasping for breath.
title: Château Jeanrousse 2010  Fronsac

description: Even for the rich 2015 vintage, this is an excessive wine. Made from superripe Merlot with high extraction, it adds dark chocolate flavors to its rich, juicy blackberry jelly fruit, feeling too big and over-the-top.
title: Château Moulin Haut-Laroque 2015  Fronsac

description: A light, juicy and soft wine, it is already drinkable. It has red berry fruits, gentle tannins and acidity. A dry aftertaste comes along with fresh fruits. Drink now.
title: Château de Janicon 2011  Graves

description: Solid, dark and extracted, this hard-edged wine has too many tannins and not quite enough fruit.
title: Château de Respide 2011  Graves

description: This is a light, fresh and fruity wine, with an attractive red-berry flavor, plus acidity and a soft structure.
title: Château Toumilon 2009 Petit Toumilon  (Graves)

description: A wine that seems to be all tannin, all wood, with only a feel of black currant fruits underneath all this dryness. These flavors suggest high extraction, giving spice, a high toast wood character, all too much for a delicate 2007.
title: Château Sansey 2007  Graves

description: This romantically named estate is owned by Emmanuelle and Bertrand Amart. The wine is an attractive mix of spicy, berry fruit and dry tannins, with a measure of fresh acidity thrown in. There is an intriguing smoky finish.
title: Château Venus 2006  Graves

description: Densely tannic, this has edgy black currant flavor emerging between a firmly dry structure  packed with dark berry fruits and fresh acidity. This is light in fruit and heavy on tannins.
title: Château le Bonnat 2003  Graves

description: Under the same ownership as Château Caronne-Saint-Gemme, this, too is in a soft, ripe style, which would benefit from early drinking. It's attractive, lightly toasty and with good black fruits and acidity.
title: Château Labat 2003  Haut-Médoc

description: La Tour Carnet is a reliable cru bourgeois; this second wine is correspondingly less impressive. The aromas are muted, and the flavors tend toward earthy notes and sour cherries, with rugged tannins on the finish.
title: Les Douves de LaTour Carnet 1999  Haut-Médoc

description: Based in the heart of the Haut-Médoc, this property has produced a wine that shows a dry character, with bitter extraction and too much wood. There are just hints of juicy fruit that will need time to come through. It could well stay dry and firm always.
title: Château du Retout 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: A separate Cuvée produced from the vineyard of Château Beaumont, this has an earthy aroma, dense and extracted tannins, and still needs to find its balance. If it is to round out, it will need several years, although it could well remain tough.
title: Château d'Arvigny 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a tough wine, packed more with tannins than fruit. A bitter chocolate character comes from over-extraction of the tannins. The fruit is slow in coming, although there are hints of juiciness. Give it until 2017.
title: Château Fonséche 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is lean and austere, with extracted tannins that have left no sense of fruit. It will remain hard, although it will be less dry from 2018.
title: Château d'Hanteillan 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Closed up and firm, the wine is not showing much in the way of expressive fruitiness. It does have a firm structure, but a taste of bitter extract gives hard tannins and smothers the black currant fruit flavors. In time, it will soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Maurac 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine is hard, tough and dense. Its tannins are solid, dominant, extracted and cover any fruit. It is likely to remain dry.
title: Château Lieujean 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: In this light and fruity wine, gentle tannins underlie ripe black currant fruits. It is almost drinkable already, and will age quickly. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Fonpiqueyre 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A lean wine, hard-edged and with austere tannins. It has some berry fruits that are submerged by the tense tannins and acidity. At the end, smoky wood aging flavors dominate.
title: Château Tourteran 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A black currant-flavored wine, it initially feels light and then broadens to give black currant and spice flavors. The tannins give a very dry character, leaving the fruit to struggle. Not for long-term aging; drink from 2016.
title: Château Aney 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Wood flavors smother the fruit. It has spice, a burnt smokiness and a bitter-chocolate character. The wine does show some juiciness and fresh acidity at the end.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A hard-edged wine, it's very firm and very dry. It is all structure, showing little in the way of fruit potential.
title: Château d'Arche 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: An austere, structured wine, this is dominated by strong wood flavors. It has dark chocolate, bitter tannins with the fruit element submerged. At this stage, it doesn't have the weight to fully integrate fruit and structure.
title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: An austere wine, serious and densely dry. It has some weight and a firm center, with the fruit lagging behind the structure. This is always likely to be tannic.
title: Château Lanessan 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A thin wine, with tight stalkiness and smoky, dry tannin flavors. It certainly is fresh, the acidity very marked, black currant fruits bedded into the tannins.
title: Château d'Esteau 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: This dense and rich wine is dominated by dark-chocolate flavors of excessive extraction and bitterness. The fruit is hard to find in this wine that will probably remain tough.
title: Château Doyac 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This tastes lean, the fruit buried deep beneath hard, dry fruit tannins. There is an old style austerity here that demands food. The final juicy acidity does leave a welcome relief.
title: Château d'Arcins 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: Lean, soft and soapy in character, this has a dry core and soft tannins, with a lightweight red-berry note. Not for aging.
title: Château Vieux Ferrand 2011 Cuvée Legta  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: A smooth, vanilla-flavored wine that shows good black currant flavors. There are soft tannins, some wood notes, but there is also a stalky dryness in the background. The aftertaste leaves wood and dry fruit in equal proportions. Imported by Wine Frog.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2003  Listrac-Médoc

description: From one of two properties in Listrac owned by the Thomas family (the other is Reverdi), this is seriously dark and tannic, with flavors of bitter chocolate extract and wood. It doesn't feel as if it will really soften enough.
title: Château L'Ermitage 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: The wine is smoky, with black currant-fruits and a core of dry tannins. Those tannins are probably not going anywhere much, so while the fruit and acidity will soften, the wine will always be dry.
title: Château La Fleur Poitou 2013  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: Heavy wood aromas lead to a wine that's dominated by burnt wood with only subdued fruit. It's packed with tannins that are tough and extracted, giving a bitter coffee flavor. Although it will soften, the wine will likely keep its dry, tough character.
title: Château Haut Breton Larigaudiére 2012  Margaux

description: A wine that tries too hard. The extract is strong, giving some bitterness. And, although the berry fruits are sweet and rich, the tannins edge the fruit with hardness. On the finish, some smokiness enhances the black currant juice, but that astringency just won't go away.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Margaux)

description: Vineyards in the northern Médoc have produced a wine that while offering some attractive black-currant fruit also has an excess of wood flavors. At this stage, the fruit should be more prominent and the wine possibly will remain toasty and woody.
title: Château Lalande Villeneuve 2014  Médoc

description: Quite minty and herbal, but balanced somewhat by cherry, blackberry and vanilla flavors. A medium-weight quaffer with a fresh, cinnamon note to the finish.
title: Yvon Mau 2002 Yvecourt  (Médoc)

description: There was a generous use of wood aging here and it shows in the wood and toast flavors. The wine has bitter chocolate as well as black-currant fruits suggesting overenthusiastic extraction.
title: Château Tour Saint Vincent 2014  Médoc

description: The wine seems to have too much high-toast wood aging for its own good. This wood has masked the fruit and taken much of the richness of the wine. It could soften and broaden although it will probably remain too dry.
title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2014  Médoc

description: This is an obviously wood-aged wine with plenty of toast flavors. This wood aging has flattened the fruit giving a wine that is soft with few tannins. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Laffitte Laujac 2012  Médoc

description: Tight and stalky, this wine has smoky red-berry fruits and a strong layer of acidity. Still young, it will certainly soften, although it is likely to remain light and lean. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2013  Médoc

description: This stalky, tight wine has a smoky character, lean black-currant fruits and a tough, possibly unripe fruitiness. It is developing fast, drink from 2017.
title: Château Bournac 2013  Médoc

description: Too enthusiastic use of wood has left this wine bereft of fruit and unbalanced.
title: Château Monfort Bellevue 2012  Médoc

description: The producer has probably used too much wood for the fruit and density of this wine. The toastiness does not allow any fruit to show through.
title: Château la Gravette Lacombe 2013  Médoc

description: This wine is lean and stalky, with firm, dry tannins that don't give much room for fruitiness. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Blaignan 2013  Médoc

description: Considerable toasted wood flavors show from both the aroma and the initial taste. The fruit is lean, without the weight needed for balance. It's likely to remain an austere wine.
title: Château Lousteauneuf 2012  Médoc

description: Firm and structured, this is a lean and austere wine. It has solid tannins while the juicy acidity and red berry fruits are crisp with hints of green, underripe Cabernet.
title: Château Le Bourdieu 2012  Médoc

description: This wine is bottled by the local Médoc cooperative, although it comes from a single estate. With firm tannins and a dense structure, it's austere. The stalky black fruits are only just ripe, giving a green pepper character.
title: Château Clément Saint-Jean 2012  Médoc

description: Strong wood aromas continue into the palate of this burnt toast and bitter-chocolate-flavored wine. It is extracted and with a bitter edge. The juiciness from the fruit only emerges slowly and tentatively.
title: Château La Branne 2012  Médoc

description: Gravel and limestone soils provide two different origins for this wine. That said, burnt wood and smoky tannins are the only tastes at the moment. the wine does have enough weight and potential to soften out, so drink from 2017.
title: Clos du Moulin 2012  Médoc

description: This lean wine lacks fruit to support the dry tannins. That probably comes from the extraction that has also caused some bitterness. It's a hard wine that needs time to soften.
title: Château Leboscq 2012  Médoc

description: This is dark and firm with a tough, austere character. It has weight, but the bitterness of too-much extraction gives a hard edge. The juiciness at the end doesn't compensate.
title: Château Maison Blanche 2011  Médoc

description: This firmly tannic wine has all the structure of 2010 without the fruit. It's a skeleton without flesh, and it will be unlikely to soften in the coming years.
title: Château la Gorre 2010  Médoc

description: This wine has a barnyard flavor, and its black currant fruit shows a bitter edge. The tannins are firm and dry, likely to soften with age.
title: Château d'Escurac 2010  Médoc

description: An obviously wood-aged wine, this shows a bitter toast character. The fruit is lean, struggling to show through the dark chocolate flavor. It has an austere finish, which is mitigated by its final acidity.
title: Château Le Bourdieu 2010  Médoc

description: A wine that is lean and angular, austere, the fruit dominated by very dry tannins. It misses weight with the licorice, meaty flavors and a hard-edged structure.
title: Château Ramafort 2007  Médoc

description: Very light, the fruit is soft, easily attractive but rather muted. Flavors are of spice, black figs and stewed plums, the acidity a factor along with the wood.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2007  Médoc

description: A structured wine, full of fresh black berry fruits, red plum skins and fresh acidity. There is a bell pepper element, but the light texture is spiced and rounded with wood.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2007 Famille Lapalu  (Médoc)

description: Bright red fruits dominate this easy-drinking wine. It has some funky tannins, rustic perhaps, that intrude into the otherwise easy fruitiness of the wine.
title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Charmes du  (Médoc)

description: This wine has too much wood for its own good. By now, this should be softening but it is not. There's not enough room for what could be crisp berry fruit. It might soften, but the bitter wood-aging character suggests not.
title: Château Troussas 2014  Médoc

description: This tight and mineral-driven wine is still firmly tannic. That core of dryness is likely to remain even while the black-currant fruit matures. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Calmeyrac 2012  Médoc

description: A serious commitment to wood aging has given this wine a dark-chocolate and extracted set of flavors. This masks the wine, which seems almost austere. It will likely remain tough.
title: Château Tour Castillon 2015  Médoc

description: This is lean and structured, with some juicy fruit showing through the bright berries, but also around a core of tannins, acidity, bell peppers and a cool aftertaste.
title: Calvet 2005 Réserve de l'Estey  (Médoc)

description: A jammy wine it has ripe red berry fruits, soft tannins and a red plum jelly flavor. It will age quickly, so drink from 2016.
title: Château la Fleur 2011  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Juicy wine, with very dominant acidity. The flavors are of bright red plums and berries, but the wine lacks depth, skimming the surface of taste.
title: Château la Fleur 2008  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Hard around the edges, this wine does have some fruit, but this is masked by the bitter chocolate and burnt tannins. Juiciness surfaces in the aftertaste, but almost as an afterthought.
title: Château Baston-Brillette 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Made by the Pauillac cooperative, this is a pleasant, lightweight wine, a surprise considering the vintage. There are black currant flavors, but the wood element is too dominant for the fruit.
title: La Rose de Pauillac 2003  Pauillac

description: This wine is lean, austere with high acidity that leaves fruit well behind. It is structured and dry, only hinting at black-currant freshness. This third-generation family estate also hosts monthly musical and tasting events and sells fruit, vegetables and honey.
title: Château Bardins 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is not balanced, with wood and acidity opposing each other. It has spice, high toast flavors and stalky black currants. Although it could have potential, it is likely to remain tough. The property is unusual-133 acres in one block.
title: Château la Garde 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This unbalanced wine is caught between acidity and wood. It is hard to see how well this will develop. Owner Francis Boutemy, an inventor, created the "Bout'mobile" which glides seated pickers along rows as they cut clusters that are dropped directly into a mobile sorting machine.
title: Château Haut Lagrange 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a simple, tank-aged wine, without any pretensions to complexity. But it has full, red fruit and licorice flavors, plus good tannins. For the difficult 2002 vintage, this is a good wine. Imported by William Grant & Sons.
title: Château la Rose Bellevue 2002 Cuvée Tradition  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: A wine that still shows some youthful tannins, but is maturing well, its freshness subsumed into the red plum and jelly flavors. It is ready to drink now, but should be decanted.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2004  Premieres Cotes de Blaye

description: From a vintage known for its readily-approachable wines, this grand cru Saint-Emilion shows surprising structure. Some toasty oak frames delicate black-cherry fruit. Black tea notes on the finish carry more tannins than the fruit can handle in the long run, so catch this one soon before it heads south.
title: Château Lapelletrie 1997  Saint-Émilion

description: The wine suffers from heavy extraction that has left wood rather than fruit. Somewhere in there, the black-currant fruit and acidity are struggling. It will soften, although that wood will remain a problem.
title: Château Pipeau 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: An oddly balanced wine, showing both light texture and maturity. Spice, beetroot flavors and tense acidity surface, along with a dry aftertaste.
title: Château Corbin 2004 XX de Corbin  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A burnt-toast, spicy aroma is followed by fresh black currant flavors. This is a light wine, but it is balanced, with the wood fitting well into the fruit. Drink now.
title: Mähler-Besse 2007 Cheval Noir  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Already mature, this is a light, mushroom and spice flavored wine. The fruit is now a part of the secondary flavors, a nutmeg sweetness giving some interest. To be drunk now.
title: Château Corbin Michotte 2003  Saint-Émilion

description: Light and fresh with black currant flavors, this is a simple wine, with attractive, easy fruit, just given weight by tannins and some juicy finishing acidity.
title: Château Picau-Perna 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: This Bordeaux from Abarbanel is full of black cherry, root, and oak. All in all it's not bad. Some sweet cherry is at the core, and on the edges you'll find a slight leafiness and some sweet supporting oak. Integrated tannins make the finish smooth. --M.S.
title: Marquis de Saint-Estephe 1997 Grand Vin du Médoc  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: This is a lean wine that feels to have only structure and very little fruit. There are dry, dense tannins and a firm texture that will only soften marginally.
title: Château Arnaud 2011  Saint-Estéphe

description: Light and fruity, this shows attractive red fruit, ample tannins and acidity. An earthy character to the wine is less pleasant.
title: Château la Haye 2011 Fief de la Haye  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: When a Bordeaux wine gets into a heavy bottle, it has something to prove. As here, when the wine has way too much wood and lacks fruit. It could balance out, but that is a long shot.
title: Château la Croizille 2009  Saint-Estéphe

description: A subsidiary label of Chateau Gruaud Larose, obviously destined for earlier drinking than the grand vin. Supple tannins frame cedar, tobacco and earth notes, while the light frame holds just enough flesh to avoid leanness.
title: Chevalier de Gruaud 1999  Saint-Julien

description: Offers up decent aromas of sour cherries, then folds in leather and earth notes on the palate. This is an easy-to-drink claret for immediate consumption-little tannin, some coffee, tart cherries for balance.
title: J. D. Laurent 2002  Bordeaux

description: Bright, fresh wine with a light wood touch. The acidity highlights black currant flavors exacerbated by some greenness.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2008 La Patache  (Médoc)

description: A lean wine, with a core of oak, herb and citrus flavors. Briary blackberry, anise and coffee notes add interest, finishing with a tannic bite. Kosher
title: Sarget de Gruaud-Larose 2000  Saint-Julien

description: This 100% Merlot is firm, dry and structured. Although the fruit is there, it has been submerged by tannins. Give it a few months for the ripe berry flavors to come through. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2013 Merlot du Château Sainte Barbe  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine's bright purple fruit tastes as if the fermentation has only just stopped. Jammy red berries are laced with some tannins, and acidity freshens the wine, only spoilt by a slight oxidative edge.
title: Château de Lagarde 2012 Cuvée Nature  (Bordeaux)

description: Berry fruits and dense red jelly flavors are the hallmark of this wine. It is full, although edging on stalky, its black berry flavors mixed with acidity and dry tannins.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2008 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: This soft wine has a smooth texture and little in the way of tannins. That brings out its red fruit, juicy acidity and light spice notes. Ready to drink.
title: Calvet 2016 Limited Release  (Bordeaux)

description: Certainly soft, as befits a pure Merlot wine, with smoky tannins and cranberry fruit juice flavors. There is a coolness to the wine, heightened by the acidity, a product of the vintage.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007  Bordeaux

description: This structured wine has ripe black fruits followed by red berries. There is a good depth of flavor, the tannins giving the bright fruit weight and a mouthfilling character.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2006 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: While there are firm tannins, this wine also has plenty of fresh black currant fruits. Acidity and a crisp texture give it a lift and brightness. Drink this 100% Merlot from 2016 when the tannins have softened.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2013 Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: That this wine is all Merlot is the reason both for its jammy richness and its high alcohol. It gives a wine that is out of balance, with pepper, spice and wood dominating the super-ripe black cherry fruits. It's unlikely to age for long.
title: Château de Brondeau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This juicy wine from 100% Merlot suggests overripe fruit. Hints of beets and red berries are shot through with acidity. Drink this jammy wine soon.
title: Château Brethous 2016 Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and jammy, this wine has tannins as well as red-berry flavors. It is unbalanced and seems old-fashioned and hot.
title: Clos Les Remparts 2016  Graves

description: Turns citrusy and tart on the finish, but this is a decent little claret nonetheless. Smells just right, with cedar, vanilla and cherries combining on the nose, then delivers a light, satiny-smooth mouthful of tart berries and vanilla flavor.
title: Calvet 2002 Calvet Reserve  (Bordeaux)

description: IToo much wood aging has masked the potential of the juicy black fruits of this unusual 100% Petit Verdot wine. It does have weight but that wood is overwhelming.
title: Château Mirambeau Papin 2009 Papin  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Buying branded Bordeaux can be a risky business. But a few of the Bordeaux négociants make some good value brands that also offer decent quality. This is one of them. From the great 2000 vintage, it is ripe, lively and fresh, but at the same time has some depth of flavor with red fruits, a layer of wood and the acidity that makes red Bordeaux great with rich foods.
title: Yvon Mau 2000 Premius  (Bordeaux)
